name: Cave mushroom
description: A mushroom from a damp cave. It would probably be best not to eat it, but some alchemy recipes must certainly call for it.

name: Antlers
description: Antler pieces, most likely the remnants of a much more formidable hunting trophy. They can be sold or used to mix potions.

name: Charcoal
description: Charcoal is wood burnt in kilns by pyrolysis without influx of air. It is used primarily in forges and smelting works, and to a lesser extent in alchemy for its filtration properties.

name: Cobweb
description: The essential material of a spider's dwelling and of certain magic potions.

name: Fly agaric
description: A brightly coloured mushroom that draws attention to itself. Potentially life threatening when consumed by humans. In small doses, though, it can have various effects and is thus often used in alchemy.

name: Wild boar's tusk
description: A nice boar-hunting trophy. Who knows how many men's backsides this boar tusk has torn into? Sure to enchant damsels, but can be used in various elixirs as well.

name: Belladonna
description: It grows in clearings and in leafy woods, but it is best not to seek it out at all.

name: Chamomile
description: Most often it is found in fields and fertile land.

name: Comfrey
description: Grows most of all on banks by water and in ditches around fields.

name: Dandelion
description: Grows everywhere as a weed, but mostly on grassy slopes and meadows it is to be found.

name: Eyebright
description: Grows on pastures and heaths and in all places where there is light enough, as well as wet ground.

name: Herb Paris
description: It may be sought in deep woods.

name: Marigold
description: Grows where the earth is fertile - on rubble piles and dung and abundantly too in pastures.

name: Mint
description: It is rarely found in nature, but rather, alongside houses and in gardens cultivated.

name: Nettle
description: It can be found abundantly by water, on the edge of woods and in the furrows of fields.

name: Poppy
description: It is found abundantly in fields and furrows as a bothersome weed.

name: Sage
description: To be found on pastures and on hillsides.

name: St. John's Wort
description: It is most fond of leafy woods, glades and clearings.

name: Thistle
description: It grows in roadside ditches, in clearings, and where there is relief from the sun and rather shadow gathers.

name: Valerian
description: To be found on forest paths, in mires and peat bogs, and everywhere the ground is damp.

name: Wormwood
description: Abundant grows on roadsides and in fields.

name: spiritus (spirits)
description: A strong spirit that will burn away all physical and spiritual woes

name: aqua (water)
description: Water

name: vinum (wine)
description: Excellent wine, the consumption of which can lead to fun, song, drunken blabbering, loss of memory and empty purses.

name: oleum (oil)
description: Oil
